fields.description:
Hi all, 

We are using a cascading select customfield which allow user to enter the module and submodule relating to the issue. 
When developers are searching for issues, they would like to be able to select more than one value on the submodules (several value in a cascading select list).

"Currently the submodule selection field is single-valued, it would be good if one could query on several submodules at once."

What could be the best solution to meet this need ?

Thanks in advance.
Cheers.
Pierrick.
fields.summary: Be able to select several value in a cascading select list

fields.description:
Hi all,

Our Jira users are requesting the possibility to negate some criteria when performing when searching issues. This is especially important for attributes which have a large number of possible values.
For example, it would be nice to be able to define a query:
"Find all open issues which are *not* on version 4.5 or 4.6".
Right now, to get this results one has to select all the versions except 4.5 and 4.6, which is error-prone.  

Thank you for looking at this possibilities. 
Cheers
Pierrick.
fields.summary: Be able to negate any condition when using the "Find issue" tool

fields.description:
When the issue will be resolved, the project leader gets a validation email. The email header is correct (e.g. [JIRA] Resolved (XX-1) "description" ) But in the email there ist a long error message:



An error occured whilst redering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug.
Details:
______
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Inovation of method 'printChangelog' in class
com.atlassian.jira.util.JiraVelocityHelper threw exception class
com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException : Invalid status name "Open".
     at
org.apache ....



The status settings for the issues are right, only the emails when its closed make problems.
Is there maybe a problem with the SMTP server or did I make a wrong setting in the workflow or notification scheme?

Thanks, Fabian
fields.summary: When resolving an issue I get an error mail

fields.description:
Investigate caching 'EditActions' on Bulk Workflow Transition 'edit fields' screen.

The getEditActions(String FieldScreenTabName) method is called twice from the bulkworkflowtransition_editfields.jsp - once to actually display the fields for editing and once again for the Javascript auto-checking of the check-boxes.
fields.summary: Investigate caching 'EditActions' on Bulk Workflow Transition 'edit fields' screen

fields.description:
Say a Windows user attaches a file called "5/4/06_test.txt" to an email, and sends it to JIRA (polling a POP/IMAP service) running on unix. JIRA creates an issue or comment with this attachment. However it prints a warning:

{noformat}
2006-07-07 11:31:23,038 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Creating attachment without a file.  Aborting
{noformat}

and in the attachments directory, one finds the file saved, but in an invalid/unusual format, with a subdirectory:

./10003_5/4/06_test.txt

The URL to the attachment will be something like:

http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/attachment/10003/5%2F4%2F06_test.txt

This URL works with Tomcat, but mod_proxy and mod_jk don't like it. One gets the error:

{noformat}
Not Found

The requested URL /jira/secure/attachment/10003/5/4/06_test.txt was not found on this server.
Apache/2.0.54 (Debian GNU/Linux) DAV/2 SVN/1.2.3 mod_python/3.1.3 Python/2.3.5 PHP/4.4.0-4 mod_perl/2.0.1 Perl/v5.8.7 Server at localhost Port 80
{noformat}

To fix this we need to check filenames for invalid characters ("/"), and if present, store the file on disk with the invalid characters stripped. Since the name the file is served as is stored in the database, it doesn't actually matter what the filename on the server is - it will be served to the user correctly.
fields.summary: Attachments with invalid filenames not stored/served correctly with mod_jk and mod_proxy

fields.description: With the latest Perforce server 2006.1, job updates fail. Further details available at PERF-93.
fields.summary: Fix PERF-93 - Perforce plugin job updates fail with Perforce Server 2006.1

fields.description:
If a new issue tab panel is added without a 'Order' value set in the {{issue-tabpanel}} module, then it is displayed as the first tab initially (after the {{All}} tab).
But after selecting the new tab panel, the ordering of the tab panels change (Usually the selected tab panel appears last).
fields.summary: Issue tab panels are reordered after tab panel selection

fields.description:
A customer has raised this issue at [JSP-6168|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-6168].

The particular doc page can be found at [http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#messagehandlers].
fields.summary: Docs should be updated to say RegExCommentHandler is only available for a POP service and not an IMAP service

fields.description:
When either an IMAP or POP service is created and then edited, the Handler drop down select list contains a handler called 'Email Handler' which should not be there.

It is also not documented at [http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html] so nothing needs to be changed there.
fields.summary: Email Handler should be removed from Handler select list when editing POP and IMAP services

fields.description:
The second Ant task that I pasted into a comment field did not get its less-than character ('<') escaped properly on output.  See this comment for details:

http://www.jetbrains.net/jira/browse/IDEA-8166#action_51297

I will attempt to reproduce the problem on this bug after filing it.
fields.summary: XML tag not escaped in comment
CreateOrCommentHandler should have parameter for priority

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Ensure when clicking on 'Browse Project' menu tab, a *project isn't already selected* but a list of All projects are shown 
2. Change locale from None to one that's not English (Profile -> Edit Preferences)
3. Click Update
--> Other menu tabs are internationalised except 'Browse Projects'
4. Click on 'Browse Projects'
5. Select a project
--> 'Browse Project' is translated

Note. If Step 1 above is changed to ensuring that when you click on 'Browse Projects and a *project is selected* instead and then the rest of the steps are executed like normal then all translations for 'Browse Projects' are fine.
fields.summary: Changing locale causes no translation change for 'Browse Projects' menu tab unless a project has been or is already selected

fields.description: Our logo is resized (seemingly) randomly on the Dashboard and in the User Picker screen.  Can reproduce this by doing a ctrl-f5 page reload a few times.  See screenshots for the 2 affected screens and a screen of the full size logo at 100%.  We have tried every type of file we can (JPG, PNG, BMP, GIF etc) with no luck.
fields.summary: Validate that logo dimensions are integers, and not percentages
Cancel button in Comment does not have tooltip
Display warning when Assign To clashes with permission
Request to spit out MAintenance/Support when renewing maintenance.

fields.description: When the Comment link is clicked for a task, the focus of the page is changed to the textbox at the bottom of the page.  I like the way the focus changes.  It's especially helpful on tasks with lots of comments.  However, I've noticed that in both Internet Exploder and Firefox, the Add and Cancel buttons are not displayed since the textbox extends below the edge of the browser window.   Therefore, it would be nice to have the Add and Cancel buttons appear both below and above the Comment field so that I don't have to scroll down to click Add or Cancel.
fields.summary: duplicate the Add / Cancel buttons above the Comment text box

fields.description:
The screenshot applet accepts the filename "invalid->filename.jpg" without error mesage or blocking (like it does for names containing e.g. "*"). The issue shows a link in the "File Attachment" box, however, clicking the link brings up an error message:
HTTP Status 404 - Could not find specified attachment: d:\jira35\attach\ELERT\ELERT-3\23540_invalid->filename.jpg (The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect)
The screenshot is not shown and the file does not exist.
fields.summary: Screenshot applet allows invalid filename

fields.description: For the MetQuest Project (Key: MQ), can we please add a Rank or Ranking field to the issue creation screen so can rank our tasks
fields.summary: MetQuest: Please can we add the field 'Rank' or 'Ranking' so that when we create an issue we can assign it a rank

fields.description:
When moving a subtask from an issue which has an security level assigned keeps its prior security level regardless of the security level of its new parent.
Only a reassignment of the security level of its new parent synchronises the security level also to the moved subtask.
fields.summary: Moving a subtask doesn't inherit the security level of its new parent

fields.description: Related to JRA-8863, Jira should also itself add the Precedence: bulk header to email sent from Jira. This would cause majority to autoresponders not to reply to email sent from Jira. Also, adding the header is "good behavior" on behalf of automated systems that generate email, such as Jira.
fields.summary: Add Precedence: bulk to Jira email headers

fields.description: The 500 page in JIRA lists the request parameters, but does not HTML encode them. This can lead to cross site scripting.
fields.summary: Request parameters are not HTML encoded on the 500 page

fields.description:
The log file in the attached zip file contains a threadump taken during the JIRA build process where a deadlock has occurred (details at end of file).

The scheduler and the call to ManagerFactory.quickrefresh() are in contention and cause the deadlock.

Most likely, the scheduler has been started and not stopped. Need to review the tests to address this problem. 

This deadlock should not occur in normal running as all PicoContainer managers are eagerly loaded.
fields.summary: Scheduler/PicoContainer deadlock.
Need to disable user recognition of  sender in Message Handlers

fields.description:
When I create new issue and on the two screen I select value "None" at the custom field "UC:". After puss button "Create"  I can not create issue and JIRA give me error with attach file. 
When I select nothing or other value I create new issue without error.
fields.summary: Error on the custom field

fields.description: Is there a way to change the work effort logged by a user on an issue ... each people should have the right to make a wrong entry :-)
fields.summary: Provide ability to modify work effort logged on an issue

There is discrepancy in the calculation of Remaining Estimate .
Kindly check the attached Screenshot (XLS file).
fields.summary: Incorrect Remaining Estimate calculation.

fields.description:
Clicking on the Hide/Show link of a collapsible field in the issue navigator does not apply to the issue on which you click,
but on the last issue on that page containing some data in that field.
fields.summary: Hide/show of Free Text Field Custom Field does not work properly in Issue Navigator

fields.description: It would be a nice feature if it was possible to order by project and then by priority. I have a couple of filerts which gives me issues from multiple projects, and in order to get the right view of the issues, I would like to order them by project and then by priority. The "order by key" does not work good enough, since my keys are unique
fields.summary: Order by project and priority

fields.description:
It would be nice if the worklog (time-tracking) was hide-able to the customer,

What we want is to be able to log the work done but not visible to the customer.

However we also want to show the customer the ammount of hours we are charging them based on the work done.

so both internal and external time-tracking.
fields.summary: The worklog (time-tracking) hide-able to the customer

fields.description:
Creating an issue using the CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa syntax described at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+via+direct+HTML+links is not easily possible when the currently logged in user has "Modify Reporter" permission. In that case the user must specify the reporter manually every time.
---
This also applies for the Assignee field. Basically, the fields that a filled by default normally, should also be filled through this method
fields.summary: CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa should set fields with default values

fields.description:
Say we have a CVS Module associated with a project. Immediately after starting JIRA, the Version Control tab in linked issues appears fine. However, if you go to Admin -> CVS Modules, and edit the module (update it without changing any field values), then the Version Control tab contains an error:

{noformat}
The cvs commits can not be displayed for repository Test Module at the moment since the log has not yet been parsed.
 The log will be parsed the next time the VcsService runs. If you have administrators privliges you can hasten the next time 
the service will run in the service section of the Administration pages.
{noformat}

If multiple CVS modules are associated with a project, each one that has been edited will contribute one of these messages.

This persists until the VCS service runs again, or when JIRA is restarted.

To replicate:
 - Create a project with key 'TP', and an issue (TP-1).
 - Create a CVS module, with CVSROOT '/home/jturner/cvsrepo', module 'testrepo' and parsing the attached log file
 - Associate CVS module with the TP project.
 - Log in as a user with permission to see the revision control info.
 - Restart JIRA, and check that the Version Control tab appears normally on issue TP-1.
 - Edit the CVS module
 - View TP-1 again.
fields.summary: Editing a CVS module breaks Version Control tab until next service run
Invalid action error should be clearer

For example the user N/N only has the issue type "bug" and "Task" and the user M/M has the issue type "Bug" and "improvement".
Thank You.
fields.summary: Issue type for a specific user in a project

Yes, I get the description field now, but only of the first page of issues.. This problem happens on both the html and Doc export and on BOTH IE and Firefox.
I wanted to reopen the existing issues on this but I cannot reopen resolved issues, so sorry to add another issue for this already existing problem.

Add "Assign to Me" to custom user picker fields

fields.description:
I was wondering if we can have different notification schemes for different components in a particular project or is it that a project  can have just one notification scheme associated with it. For eg: I have a project configured as follows:

Project name: MYPROJECT
Components:  GeneralComponent
                            DocumentationComponent
                            InfrastructureComponent

The closest solution to this issue was to set a filter. However, it doesn't completely serve the purpose. The filter sends email after a predefined set period irrespective of whether a new issue in that component is created or not. I would like to have emails just when a new issue is created in that component and not after a pre defined period. Does someone have a solution to my problem.

Thanks,
Venkat
fields.summary: Different notification schemes for different components in a project

fields.description: Currently, when there are errors in Jelly scripts, the error messages cannot always be internationalised. Support for rendering translated messages is available in the service tier classes (e.g. ProjectRoleService and ProjectComponentService) but not all Jelly tag errors have corresponding service tier methods (e.g. jelly tag DeleteProjectRole confirm="true" attribute). A Jira AuthenticationContext could be injected into the EmbededJellyContext (sic) as long as that class became managed by the DI container.
fields.summary: Support i18n Jelly Scripting Environment
Set default collapse/expand for filter groups for new users

fields.description:
The TransitionWorkflow Jelly tag requires an assignee field. Unfortunately there is no way to find out the assignee of an existing issue, so one is forced to reset the assignee when using TransitionWorkflow.

A simple way to fix this (any any similar) problems is to create a <jira:ReadIssue> tag, that sets Jelly variables to values of the specified issue. The variables can then be reused in tags like TransitionWorkflow.
fields.summary: TransitionWorkflow Jelly tag resets the assignee

fields.description:
The feature "Remember my Login on this computer" available on the login screen contains a severe security issue: When Jira is installed at the location https://your.host.name/bugs/ (note the encryption via httpS) the JSESSIONID cookie identifying the current user is set for the current webapplication (bugs) as a secure cookie: 
http-header:
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=1DXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXC; Path=/bugs; Secure


When user chooses "Remember my Login on this computer" a second cookie is transmitted that will be returned unencrypted when a similar URL is accessed: 

Set-Cookie: seraph.os.cookie=DlElFlGlHllkasDFskjdfk; Expires=Fri, 29-Jun-2007 16:27:15 GMT; Path=/bugs


There is a "; Secure" missing here, if login is done via https. 

(hint for debugging: easy to check with Firefox plugin LiveHttpHeaders)
fields.summary: Insecure "Remember my Login" cookie on https-sites

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10507].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 25 October 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your votes and thoughts on this issue.

We fully understand that many of you are dependent on this functionality.

After careful consideration, we've decided to prioritize archiving components on Jira Server roadmap. We hope to start development after our current projects are completed. 

Expect to hear an update on our progress within the next 6 months. 

To learn more on how you suggestions are reviewed, see our updated workflow for server feature suggestions.

Kind regards,

Jira Server Product Management

{panel}
*Original request description*

I use the project components very heavily for issue list filtering and rely on them for building out lists in Confluence using the

{jiraissue}

macro.

In order to preserve those lists, I have to keep the component around, unfortunately, many times I don't necessarily need it for future work. So I don't want to present the developers with the component if it doesn't really apply to work anymore.

It would be great if there was a mechanism to "archive" components just like you would with a release version, such that the user can no longer select that component for issues.
fields.summary: Archive project components

fields.description:
I do a search with a search result > 1000 issues.
From the first page of the search I select to view as Excel by clicking on "Current fields".
I get an excel document with only 1000 issues.
If I start from another page I get the issues starting from that page.
Also in that case I get only a maximum of 1000 issues.

In my previous Jira versions (rel 3.3.3 and 3.5.1), doing an excel export I always got the whole list,
so that is my expectation also for release 3.6.2.
fields.summary: export to excel exports only up to 1000 issues

fields.description: The problem is that the javascript function that automatically checks the checkbox when teh field changes overrides the existing javascript function that updates the dependent (second) select box.
fields.summary: Second dropdown list of Cascading Select custom field does not get updated during Bulk Workflow Transition

fields.description: The way synchonization is implemented in the CombindedCachingServlet can hang the system under heavy load, this happened with jboss.jira.com. The JBoss people have submitted a reasonable looking patch attached to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-6090. We need to incorperate this change into the atlassian-cache-servlet project and include that new version in JIRA. Confluence should also get this change.
fields.summary: The CombinedCachingServlet can become a bottleneck under heavy load

fields.description:
I'm in the process of removing several hundred comments received via email from postmaster@worldbank.org from CONF-1031.

JIRA should disregard emails from postmaster@* addresses because they are only used for bounces and other clutter you don't want as a comment or issue in JIRA.

A more generic feature would be specify email addresses by regex's.
fields.summary: Mailbox monitoring should discard emails from <regex>
XML RPC Python client unable to retrieve an issue that has been moved

fields.description: According to JRA-6450 cloning and creating issues are a special type of create issue, meaning they cannot be controlled seperately with permission schemes. We would like these to be controlled seperately so certain groups do not have to see this complexity.
fields.summary: Could use a seperate permission for clone and create subtask

fields.description:
Our site is available to the internet at large, but we don't want just anyone signing up for a JIRA account.
Confluence currently provides the ability to disable public sign up but JIRA does not seem to offer this feature.
fields.summary: Provide a way to disable public 'Sign up'
Bugzilla import looses descriptions of components

fields.description:
Newer Bugzilla versions support PostgreSQL as bug database. The 'attachments' table has a field 'thedata' of
type 'bytea'.

Now PostgreSQL has two ways of storing BLOBs, see:
http://jdbc.postgresql.org/documentation/80/binary-data.html

The code in 'BugzillaImportBean.java' assumes the wrong one. So the code:

final Blob fileData = resultsSet.getBlob('thedata');

failes with the exception:

"Bad value for type int: <binary data>"

I provide a fast patch for 'BugzillaImportBean.java' for those few out there which happen to have run Bugzilla with PostgreSQL. :-)
fields.summary: Bugzilla Import PostgreSQL bytea causes "Bad value for type int" exception

fields.description: Some times I need search for several users as Assignee or Reporter (but don't search for existing group)
fields.summary: Search for several users as Assignee or Reporter

{noformat}

In 3.6, if a 'forward email' was specified, JIRA would send an email to this address:

> The error was:
> ------------------------
> "Exception creating comment null"
> ------------------------
> The error and the email that caused the error are attached to this email.

java.io.IOException
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentWithPart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMultipart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:209)

fields.summary: JIRA does not process multipart/alternative mails properly

fields.description:
The FilterStatisticsValuesGenerator maintains a map of static final objects that reference managers retrieved from ComponentManager.

However, when the managers are refreshed throughout the JIRA lifecycle - e.g. ManagerFactory.globalrefresh() called after an import - the manager references held in FilterStatisticsValuesGenerator are not updated. Hence, the statistics displayed after an import will be out of date as the original manager references are used.

The FilterStatisticsValuesGenerator should be modified to be singleton and each client should declare its dependency on FilterStatisticsValuesGenerator through its constructor.
fields.summary: FilterStatisticsValuesGenerator retains references to managers through static final references

fields.description: Frequently, one wishes to clone most of an issue, but edit one field. This could be facilitated by adding a 'Clone and edit' button next to the 'Clone' button, on the clone page.
fields.summary: Clone and edit button

fields.description:
When linking issues, if a comment is added, this comment should be added to both source and destination issues in the link. This has always been the behaviour of JIRA in the past. In 3.6.2 (and perhaps other versions) the link only goes to the issue one is creating the link from.

Note, there is a request for exactly this behaviour:

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-6712

However it doesn't seem this 'fix' was knowingly made, since we didn't implement the checkbox to let users choose where the comment appears, and the issue isn't marked as resolved.
fields.summary: When linking, comment only attached to one issue

fields.description:
We have more than 50 modules in our cvs repository, and there are frequently added new modules by the developers 

It would be a great feature if JIRA could import multiple modules from a CVS repository at the same time, using the same setup for all modules
fields.summary: Import multiple modules from a CVS repository

fields.description:
It would be nice insert some additional information to "Browse project" and "Dashboard" pages via RTF portlet

For example see attachment
fields.summary: Possibility to insert RTF portlet on "Browse project" and "Dashboard"

fields.description:
I made a custom field(radio button) and applicated A,B,C type Issue and didn't D type.

Later, I made a Project Statistics portlet.
The graph is displayed well, but the link(the name of the portlet) brings me a error message screen.

I understand cause of the error.
When I filter the issues, the custom field option doesn't appear with 'any issu type'.
But the filter link made automatically operates with two factors at the same time.

I think it is a bug.
In my opinion the link should make a filter with 'Issue type not D but A,B,C' automatically.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Project Statistics Link makes Error message

fields.description: Normally you don't assign an issue by hand when resolving/closing it, but do that via workflow. However, the focus is in the drop down to select a user.
fields.summary: Close/Resolve etc. issue: Focus in textbox instead of "Assign To" dropdown

ex. Anonymous (via iTrack) [itrack@barco.com]

 [ http://itrack.barco.com/browse/QA0000-4?page=all ]

    Status: Open  (was: Investigated)

> Remove etc...
fields.summary: Custom transitions do show up as Available Workflow Actions even when not logged in

fields.description: It really would be nice to have "Spelling checker" in Jira
fields.summary: Spelling checker (English at least)

1. Go to Find Issues
2. Perform search for some issues which have sub-task
3. Make export to Excel  (All fields)
4. Save and Open Excel file

There is error (see attachment)

fields.description:
When displaying a graph for a filter, the cummulative total should display the real totals, not the relative totals.

This would mean that the graph won't start at "0", but at the cummulative values at that date, giving the graph a better total view (progress speed etc)
fields.summary: Charting plugin: Cummulative totals
Ability to set initial status for an issue on creation via SOAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10471].
  {panel}

Did several changes to permission schemes and now have the system in a state where the browse users widget is disabled when logged-in as user with full privileges.   

Default permission scheme still exists, but I added two others.

On Bulk Edit Group Members page, a mouse-over of the browse-users icon (right side of page) gives tooltip that says "you do not have permission to browse users".    However I can assign users to the group if I know their userid and type it into the text field, I just cannot browse the list of possible users with the widget.

I am logged in as user who is member of jira-administrators group and this group as all privileges assigned.

With the same login, I can go to the User Browser page and assign users and groups without a problem.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Group Members checks for 'Browse User' permission but User Browser doesn't

fields.description:
When there are a lot of fields (as when used by a large organization) the user can bust a vein trying to hide/reorder fields. So I thought I could fool the system and clock a Hide link, wait one-one thousand, and click the next one, then repeat. This worked, until I got about half way thru (30  minutes later), and all the fields I hid had reappeared as Visible. OMG, if I had a rocket launcher...

Anyway, suggest you use the checkbox approach that is common for email applications. 

Also, this message is lame. Just filter them out:
Note: Not all the fields below are shown on creation of each issue (eg custom fields which are only per-project).
fields.summary: EditFieldLayoutHide.jspa needs major improvements

fields.description: Would like to perform caseless queries. Our version is a little dated, not sure if added to a later release.
fields.summary: Caseless Searches on UserBrowser page

fields.description:
h4.Improvement 

At the time of choosing a JDK it would've been nice to know about: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9198.
The warning was only found in the atlassian-jira.log after installation was already completed.  We had JVM 1.5 already installed and decided to use it for Jira as well.
It would be nice to add the same warning in the "Installing Java" section of the documentation.

h4.Suggested Location to place comment

Installing Java 

Some JDK version notes:

To build JIRA from source, you will need JDK 1.4 or above 
Older JIRA releases (JIRA 3.1.1 and earlier) do not work 100% with JDK 1.5 due to a JDK bug that affects filter subscriptions. The problem has been worked around in JIRA 3.2 and above. 
For FreeBSD, you'll need JDK 1.4.2-p5 or above.
fields.summary: Add comment of using JVM version 1.5_06-b05 in "Installing Java" section of Documentation.

fields.description:
The word export functionality from the issue navigator does not export correct documents. This occurs in my local installation as well in my customers installation as well in your current jira.atlassian.com installation. It doesn't matter if the result list contains just 1 entry or several!

The word export from the issue detail page works fine.

Since the document file-size looks reasonable (e.g. about 500k for 150 entries) it seems that just the generated html content is corrupted. When you open such an document (see attached export from your jira.atlassian.com installation) not even the first entry will be displayed completely.
fields.summary: Bulk word export (issue navigator) does not produce correct/complete docs

fields.description: I need to set up a filter which searches on whether a specific field is blank.  How can I do this?
fields.summary: Need to Find Issues that have a blank field
Support for electronic signatures
Add ability to make Comment field required on Edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10463].
  {panel}

From the remote API there is currently no way to get a list of project categories or determine which projects belong to which categories.  The attached files add services to:
* Get project categories
* Get projects of a category
* Get projects that have no category
fields.summary: Add remote service to get project categories and projects in a category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10462].
  {panel}

A neat plugin would be a Custom Field that every time a value is stored it creates an entry in jiraactions.
You could add this to a transition screen.  
Every time it is saved, an entry is made into the {{jiraaction}} table.

This custom field would then need a counterpart Issue Tab plugin.  this would display each value stored, along with time stamp and author.

E.g. when you resolve an issue, there is custom field called - {{Resolution Notes}}.  This is blank (or a template is used from default value).
The person making the transition can then enter in the resolution notes.
When they then view the issue, there will be another tab that displays all the resolution notes.


Wouldn't be too hard to do either.
fields.summary: Custom Field whose values get displayed in issue tab

fields.summary: Deleting an issue type breaks custom fields that had used it

fields.description:
On the Browse Project screen, there are a number of useful pieces of summary information.  But this can only be viewed for one project at a time.

It would be very nice to allow viewing the "Project Statistics" and "Open Issues" for multiple projects.  Either by Filter, or by Project Category, or All projects would be great.  I don't mind if it's a Report or a screen accessed from the main Browse Project screen.

Obviously, some of the information wouldn't be relevant (like Components and Versions).
fields.summary: Allow "Browse Project" to browse multiple projects (Filter, Category, All)

fields.description:
We typically do a lot of reporting out of the changelogs to properly capture the number of defects opened against a release and to categorize their final status.  It is particularly important for us to capture defects that are deferred from one release to the next.  Reporting against the Jiraissue table causes deferred defects to simply drop off of the face of the earth.  

It would be more convenient (and moderately more performant) to do these types of reports if a defect's complete lifecycle were captured in the changelog rather than everything that happened after the issue was originally entered.  Please note that this would need to apply to any kind of issue creation event (user created, import created, SOAP created, e-mail handler created).

For my purposes, all I really care about is capturing the creation event.  I don't care about capturing the initial state of each of the fields.  If I really need to get there and because this is almost never an issue, I can infer that by working backwards from the current state of an issue using the changelog.
fields.summary: Jira changelogs don't capture the issue creation event.

fields.description: We would like to have in the issue forms two fields in a row (not as there is right now 1)
fields.summary: Two fields in a row

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10455].
  {panel}

It would be nice to able to create a separate web application with a separate data model, offering whatever functionality is desired such as contacts management, SLA management or whatever.

And then create a custom field in Jira which has a drop down selector tied to a column in an SQL table belonging to that application. So when in Jira you can open a selector and choose one of the records in the external application.

For instance when creating an issue you could select a customer, which lives in a separate application. Or you could choose an SLA agreement.

The Custom field would need to be configured with the SQL table name, the SQL column name containing a unique identified and the SQL column name containing a human readable description of the row. For additional flexibility you may need to configure a database connection so you can connect to an external database.
fields.summary: Custom SQL field
ProjectDelete action directly removes versions from database without going through CachingVersionStore

fields.description: When performing a bulk edit operation, my custom fields show up in the list of fields to edit, but the text boxes (or radio buttons) do not appear to the right of the field name.
fields.summary: When performing bulk edits, most custom fields are not editable

fields.description:
One of our issue is not found.
We entered an issue 'JNO-87'. And there are no problem searching the issue.
We can see the issue in the issue navigator(Attatchment-1).
But when we click the issue to see details, we can only see the error message(Attacment-2).

We want to delete the issue and make same issue again.
But we don't know where the contents of the issue displayed in navigator.

How can we solve this problem?
fields.summary: A issue is not in existence.

fields.description: Currently, when you _view an issue details (as Word document)_, the issue status is not displayed. It is an inconsistency compared to _view as XML document_.
fields.summary: View issue details (Word export) should contain issue status

fields.description:
It can be very usefull to have an abillity to switch jira in read-only mode. During our last problems with database, which is hosted several application including Confluence and Jira, all mentioned services was unavailable. It is desirable to be able to run some kind of backup instance of Jira in read-only mode: data can be searched and viewed, but not modified. This could decrease downtime during upgrade, too. 

Several testers of our team really suffer, if they havn't loved bug-tracking system online. :-) 

There is an issue JRA-1924 which seems to be forgotten for a long time. It suggests very similar functionality and there are ten votes for it.
fields.summary: Allow to switch Jira to read-ony mode

fields.description:
Hi,

Please add the ability to create components via Web Service
fields.summary: Create new component via web service

fields.description:
Hi,

Please add the ability to create new components via web interface.
fields.summary: Create new component via web service
